system.description: You taste a creature's flesh or blood, unlocking genetic memories of its evolutionary past. Over the next hour you regress it to an ancestral form with gentle song. This is dangerous for the target and it suffers [[/r 1d8x]] damage from severe stress. First, add [[/r 1d3]] to one ability of choice, then subtract [[/r 1d3]] from a different random ability. Next, the target saves. If it fails, it loses a random trait. Finally, the target gains a primitive trait such as a prehensile tail, gripping feet, powerful fangs, curly fur, clawed fingers, or brachiating arms.

power.overcharge: The spell is not dangerous to the target, it suffers no stress damage, and it gets a bonus to save its original traits. Note: Using this power on the same creature multiple times is very dangerous, with a large chance of creating a malevolent ooze.
